alert.note: Alert for Kennebec; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 03 at 6:58PM EDT until May 06 at 6:30AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Kennebec River At Augusta affecting Kennebec County. Kennebec River At Skowhegan affecting Kennebec and Somerset Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Merrimack and Belknap Counties. Lamprey River Near Newmarket affecting Rockingham and Strafford Counties. For the Saco River...including Conway...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Kennebec River...including Skowhegan, North Sidney, Augusta, Hallowell...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Lamprey River...including Newmarket...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Kennebec River at Skowhegan. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 35,000.0 cfs, Flooding begins at campgrounds in Skowhegan. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:15 PM EDT Wednesday the flow was 38,000.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 6:15 PM EDT Wednesday was 38,000.0 cfs. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 42,210.0 cfs early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood flow is 35,000.0 cfs. &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
